definitions.definition: A tropical disease causing a sore throat and tongue, and disturbed digestion; psilosis.
(founding) The hole through which melted metal is poured into the gate, and thence into the mold.
(founding) Material that cools in the feed channels to a mold.
To remove the sprues (material left in feed channels) from a cast piece.
A reduction of some sort in an existing program.
Maneuver where the surfer turns and surfs back towards where the wave is breaking.
(roofing) Solvent-thinned bitumen used in cold process roofing adhesives, cements and coatings.
An offensive pass played into a position further from the attacking goal line.
Any of several different types of kitchen apparatus used to brew and filter coffee.
At a distance; disconnected.
definitions.example: A remote operator may control the vehicle with a wireless handset.

definitions.definition: Distant or otherwise inaccessible.
definitions.example: After his fall from the emperor's favor, the general was posted to a remote outpost.

definitions.definition: (especially with respect to likelihood) Slight.
definitions.example: There was only a remote possibility that we would be rescued as we were far outside of the regular shipping lanes.

definitions.definition: Emotionally detached.
definitions.example: After her mother's death, my friend grew remote for a time while she dealt with her grief.

definitions.definition: A sharp or witty reply, or one which turns an argument against its originator; a comeback.
A flask with a rounded base and a long neck that is bent down and tapered, used to heat a liquid for distillation.
A airtight vessel in which material is subjected to high temperatures in the chemical industry or as part of an industrial manufacturing process, especially during the smelting and forging of metal.
A pressure cooker
To say something sharp or witty in answer to a remark or accusation.
To make a remark which reverses an argument upon its originator; to return, as an argument, accusation, censure, or incivility.
definitions.example: to retort the charge of vanity

definitions.definition: To bend or curve back.
definitions.example: a retorted line

definitions.definition: To throw back; to reverberate; to reflect.
To heat in a retort.
A person who attends rave parties, or who belongs to that subculture.
A person who raves or rants.
A process of force-feeding a goose for foie gras
A process of force-feeding cattle for veal
Feeding by means of a tube passed into the stomach
To stuff or glut with something
Someone who owns a house as a place of residence; a householder.

Someone (traditionally a woman) employed to look after the home, typically by managing domestic servants or superintending household management; also someone with equivalent duties in a hotel, institution etc.
definitions.example: She was their third housekeeper, but after a month or so she also gave up.

definitions.definition: Someone who manages the running of a home, traditionally the female head of the household.
Someone who keeps to their house; someone who rarely ventures away from home; an unadventurous person, a homebody.
To interact with others
To instruct somebody, usually subconsciously, in the etiquette of a society
To take something into collective or governmental ownership
A wish of happiness or safety at parting, especially a permanent departure
A departure; the act of leaving
Incapable of being foreseen or anticipated
One who is compulsorily enrolled, often into a military service; a draftee.
definitions.example: The soldier was a conscript.

definitions.definition: To enrol(l) compulsorily; to draft; to induct.
Drafted into a military service or similar.
Enrolled; written; registered.
An offer made in reply to an unacceptable offer.
To offer as a counteroffer.
Having red as its color.
definitions.example: The girl wore a red skirt.

definitions.definition: (of hair) Having an orange-brown or orange-blond colour; ginger.
definitions.example: Her hair had red highlights.

definitions.definition: (of a card) Of the hearts or diamonds suits. Compare black
definitions.example: I got two red queens, and he got one of the black queens.

definitions.definition: (often capitalized) Supportive of, related to, or dominated by a political party or movement represented by the color red:
Amerind; relating to Amerindians or First Nations
Of the lower-frequency region of the (typically visible) part of the electromagnetic spectrum which is relevant in the specific observation.
Having a color charge of red.
The horizontal member protruding from the base of a window frame
To make (someone or something) sensitive or responsive to certain stimuli.
To make (someone) increasingly aware of, in a concerned or sensitive way.
definitions.example: Ever since the burglary, we've been more sensitized to home security issues.

definitions.definition: To render capable of being acted on by actinic rays of light.
That sensitizes
Open land that has an acidic peaty soil and is mostly covered with heather or bracken.
Not completed.
A surface, usually resting on cupboards or drawers that can be used to work on. Usually in a kitchen.
definitions.example: The cupboards were oak and the worktop was granite.

definitions.definition: Something recurring across a genre or type of art or literature, such as the ‘mad scientist’ of horror movies or the use of the phrase ‘once upon a time’ as an introduction to fairy tales; a motif.
A figure of speech in which words or phrases are used with a nonliteral or figurative meaning, such as a metaphor.
Mathematical senses.
Musical senses.
Philosophical senses.
To use, or embellish something with, a trope.
Senses relating chiefly to art or literature.
To think or write in terms of tropes.
A company of, often touring, actors, singers or dancers.
Any group of people working together on a shared activity.
(usually in the plural) The tip of the toe.
To walk quietly with only the tips of the toes touching the ground.
Standing elevated, on or as if on the tips of one's toes.
Moving carefully, quietly, warily or stealthily, on or as if on the tips of one's toes.
The woodhen, a flightless bird of New Zealand.
A type of electronic percussion device.
To use one’s mouth, lips, tongue, voice, etc. as a percussive instrument to create beats and rhythms for music.
The skill, tendency or property of being sociable or social, of interacting well with others
definitions.example: He was a true introvert, and his sociability lagged behind others of his age in the school.

definitions.definition: One who adheres to idealism.
Someone whose conduct stems from idealism rather than from practicality.
An unrealistic or impractical visionary.
To disagree; to withhold assent. Construed with from (or, formerly, to).
To differ from, especially in opinion, beliefs, etc.
To be different; to have contrary characteristics.
The study of volcanoes.
To botch up, bumble or incompetently perform a task; to make or mend clumsily; to manage awkwardly.
To make the shrill sound characteristic of a rooster; to make a sound in this manner, either in gaiety, joy, pleasure, or defiance.
To shout in exultation or defiance; to brag.
definitions.example: He’s been crowing all day about winning the game of cards.

definitions.definition: To test the reed of a double reed instrument by placing the reed alone in the mouth and blowing it.
A cry of joy or pleasure.
Long, flat ribbons of pasta, cut from a rolled-out sheet; identical in form to tagliatelle.
Boisterous activity or behaviour, especially in sport; lively fun.
Tricky or waggish behavior; mischief.
An old Scottish parlour game in which people played various parts under penalty of a forfeit.
A substance that fixes, protects, or preserves.
(perfumery) The components of a perfume that prolong or bolster the notes, and may or may not be the base note itself.
Serving to fix or bind.
(of a task) not appreciated or rewarded
(of a person) ungrateful or unappreciative
To remove the leaves from a plant.
To remove a layer of skin, as in cosmetic preparation.
To split into scales, especially to become converted into scales as the result of heat or decomposition.
A liquid produced by steeping rose petals in water, used as a coloring agent and flavoring ingredient in certain foods.
A poisonous yellow herbicide derived from bipyridine
To assert the truth of, to affirm with confidence; to declare in a positive manner.
To prove or justify a plea.
To avouch, prove, or verify; to offer to verify.
A telephone with a simple keyboard and a small screen, used by the deaf.
The most basic or fundamental of a set of things
The final or most distant point; the conclusion
The greatest extremity; the maximum
A non-contact competitive team sport played with a 175 gram flying disc, the object of which is to score points by passing the disc to a player in the opposing end zone; ultimate frisbee.
A secondary menu available through another menu, especially one that branches off the first.
To understand (something) intuitively, to know (something) without having to think intellectually.
To fully and completely understand something in all of its details and intricacies.
definitions.example: I finally grok Perl.

definitions.definition: Something short and fat.
Excess body fat.
Dimness or blurring of the eyesight due to a fault in transmission of signals to the brain from an otherwise healthy eye.
A disorder of visual development in which the brain partially or wholly ignores input from one or both eyes.
Someone who owns a ship.
An instance of subjective, conscious experience.
A monk.
A frater house.
A comrade.
To act or behave in an inappropriate, improper, incorrect, or unexpected manner.
definitions.example: He doesn't mean to misbehave; he just doesn't know better.

definitions.definition: Any of various trees of the genus Betula, native to countries in the Northern Hemisphere.
A hard wood taken from the birch tree, typically used to make furniture.
A stick, rod or bundle of twigs made from birch wood, used for punishment.
A birch-bark canoe.
To punish with a stick, bundle of twigs, or rod made of birch wood.
To punish as though one were using a stick, bundle of twigs, or rod made of birch wood.
Trousers made from chino
To crush something, especially food, with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: When I came home, Susan was watching TV with her feet up on the couch, crunching a piece of celery.

definitions.definition: To be crushed with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: Beetles crunched beneath the men's heavy boots as they worked.

definitions.definition: To calculate or otherwise process (e.g. to crunch numbers: to perform mathematical calculations). Presumably from the sound made by mechanical calculators.
definitions.example: That metadata makes it much easier for the search engine to crunch the data for queries.

definitions.definition: To grind or press with violence and noise.
To emit a grinding or crunching noise.
To compress (data) using a particular algorithm, so that it can be restored by decrunching.
To make employees work overtime in order to meet a deadline in the development of a project.
The act or process of ratifying, or the state of being ratified.
A formal declaration of agreement to a treaty etc.
A person who holds an office, especially one appointed or elected to a public office; an incumbent
A string representing an encoded piece of text.
definitions.example: Bob cannot get any information out of the codeword since he doesn't know what transmission bases Alice used.

definitions.definition: A word or phrase (or by extension a concept) used to make a (concealed) reference to another word or concept.
A type of crossword puzzle where individual letters are represented by numbers and the solver must identify them by their position and frequency.
A leader of a group of people, especially an unofficial group.
A person who starts and leads a disturbance (such as a riot), a conspiracy, or a criminal gang.
definitions.example: The police arrested the ringleaders of the smuggling operation.

definitions.definition: To produce thunder; to sound, rattle, or roar, as a discharge of atmospheric electricity; often used impersonally.
definitions.example: It thundered continuously.

definitions.definition: To make a noise like thunder.
definitions.example: The train thundered along the tracks.

definitions.definition: To talk with a loud, threatening voice.
To say (something) with a loud, threatening voice.
definitions.example: "Get back to work at once!", he thundered.

definitions.definition: To produce something with incredible power
To unload.
To get rid of things, work, or problems by passing them on to someone or something else.
definitions.example: He offloaded the defective car onto an unsuspecting buyer.

definitions.definition: To pass the ball.
(travel) to deny a person on a standby list due to lack of space.
(travel) to change a passengers' ticket status from "checked in" to "open", allowing further changes. (This applies regardless of whether the passenger has boarded the aircraft or not).
To expose (something) to fumes; specifically, to expose wood, etc., to ammonia in order to produce dark tints.
To apply or offer incense to.
To emit fumes.
To pass off in fumes or vapours.
To express or feel great anger.
definitions.example: He’s still fuming about the argument they had yesterday.

definitions.definition: To be as in a mist; to be dulled and stupefied.
To remove or reduce; especially to reduce a quantity or number
definitions.example: If you subtract the $100 for gas from the total cost, it was a fairly inexpensive trip.

definitions.definition: A music academy.
The degree of openness of a tube, such as a blood vessel or catheter; the relative absence of blockage. Measured in percent.
Obviousness; clarity.
A climbing vine, Apios americana, of eastern North America, having fragrant brownish flowers and small edible tubers.
Any similar plant having underground tubers.
The nutlike tuber of such a plant, especially peanuts.
A plant which bears its nutlike seeds underground, such as a peanut or Bambara groundnut.
A broadcast of audiovisual material over the Internet.
To broadcast a cybercast
Thereto
Any drug used to dilate and relax the bronchial passages and ease the flow of air to the lungs
A treatment for varicose veins and hemorrhoids involving an injection of material into a blood vessel in order to make it harden and shrink
A container in which papers to be dealt with are put.
An electronic folder serving the same purpose.
The aggregate of items that demand one's attention or effort.
definitions.example: The kids, my ex, my parents, the job, bills — my inbox is full.

definitions.definition: A flat tapestry-woven carpet or rug.
Somebody from one's own country.
Of the same country; having a common sentiment of patriotism.
Experiencing discontent, dissatisfaction.
definitions.example: After her injury, Alice was a discontented woman.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to discontent.
definitions.example: He lived a discontented life.

definitions.definition: To kill with a missile fired by unmanned aircraft.
To produce a low-pitched hum or buzz.
To speak in a monotone way.
A dull humming.
A migratory route used by birds between breeding areas.
An approach to studying complex systems or ideas by reducing them to a set of simpler components.

A philosophical position which holds that a complex system is nothing but the sum of its parts, and that an account of it can be reduced to accounts of individual constituents. In a reductionist framework, the phenomena that can be explained completely in terms of relations between other more fundamental phenomena, are called "epiphenomena".

An electrical wire, cable or conduit, suspended in air by utility poles or transmission towers, or buried underground, used for the carrying of electricity either from a power source such as a generating station to a substation, or from a substation to a building such as a plant, commercial building or a home.
To open the mouth widely and take a long, rather deep breath, often because one is tired or bored, and sometimes accompanied by pandiculation.
definitions.example: I could see my students yawning, so I knew the lesson was boring them.

definitions.definition: To say while yawning.
To present a wide opening.
definitions.example: Death yawned before us, and I hit the brakes.

definitions.definition: To open the mouth, or to gape, through surprise or bewilderment.
To be eager; to desire to swallow anything; to express desire by yawning.
definitions.example: to yawn for fat livings

definitions.definition: To cut a hole or holes through the bottom, deck, or sides of (as of a ship), for any purpose.
To deliberately sink one's ship or boat by any means, usually by order of the vessel's commander or owner.
(by extension, in figurative use) Undermine or thwart oneself (sometimes intentionally), or denigrate or destroy one's position or property; compare scupper.
definitions.example: The candidate had scuttled his chances with his unhinged outburst.

definitions.definition: To move hastily, to scurry.
To change or lose color.
definitions.example: Washing light laundry with dark may cause your clothes to discolor.

definitions.definition: In a holistic manner.
Not offensive
definitions.example: an inoffensive joke

definitions.definition: Harmless
definitions.example: an inoffensive plant

definitions.definition: Profound knowledge, especially that based on learning and scholarship.
To replace or reconnect the wires of a device or installation.
definitions.example: I had to rewire the circuit where the old wires had shorted out.

definitions.definition: To change the functionality of something by altering the parameters or logic.
definitions.example: When our companies merged, I rewired our payment processing system to handle their invoices as well.

definitions.definition: A powerful compression wave produced by the movement of a body through a fluid or gas at a velocity greater than the local speed of sound.
Any violent disturbance.
A type of hardboard formed using wooden chips and blasting them into long fibers with steam and then forming them into boards.
The framework that supports a bed.
Of, pertaining to, or composed of factions.
An official license to publish or print something, especially when censorship applies.
(by extension) Any mark of official approval.
A tarp, a heavy, waterproof sheet of material, often cloth, used as a cover or blanket.
definitions.example: Throw a tarpaulin over that woodpile before it gets wet.

definitions.definition: A sailor (often abbreviated to tar)
Any heavy, waterproof material used as a cover.
Canvas waterproofed with tar, used as a cover.
A hat made of, or covered with, painted or tarred cloth, worn by sailors and others.
A young German noble or squire, especially a member of the aristocratic party in Prussia, stereotyped with narrow-minded militaristic and authoritarian attitudes.
A beat-up automobile.
A deep glen or ravine.
To change the brand name, logo, or image of a product or company.
definitions.example: Acme Co. is trying to rebrand their line of toasters under the Bewidget name.

definitions.definition: In mammals, the serous membrane lining the cavity of the abdomen and that is folded over the viscera.
In animals, the membrane lining the coelom cavity.
A person who performs evil acts.
Inherent baseness, depravity or wickedness; corruptness and evilness.
An act evident of such a depravity.
The pollen-bearing part of the stamen of a flower.
The state or quality of being strict.
definitions.example: Discipline calls for a certain strictness.

definitions.definition: The result or product of being strict.
A form of packaging containing multiple individual packages of a single product.
definitions.example: a multipack of tins of baked beans

definitions.definition: A deliberate heavy footfall; a stamp.
definitions.example: She obliterated the cockroach with one stomp.

definitions.definition: A dance having a heavy, rhythmic step.
The jazz music for this dance.
To trample heavily.
To severely beat someone physically or figuratively.
Of or pertaining to an aetiology.
The political doctrine that holds that all people in a society should have equal rights from birth.
Located behind the peritoneum.
Humanitarian philosophy or practice.
Any of various infections by fungi of the genus Aspergillus that cause granulomatous lesions
Any mollusc belonging to the taxonomic class Bivalvia, characterized by a shell consisting of two hinged sections, such as a scallop, clam, mussel or oyster.
A pericarp in which the seed case opens or splits into two parts or valves.
Frivolous act
State of being frivolous
To swallow eagerly, or in large draughts; to swallow up; to take down in one swallow.
To react nervously by swallowing.
A resistor whose resistance varies rapidly and predictably with temperature and as a result can be used to measure temperature.
Hard to grasp; not obvious or easily understood; barely noticeable.
definitions.example: The difference is subtle, but you can hear it if you listen carefully.

definitions.definition: (of a thing) Cleverly contrived.
(of a person or animal) Cunning, skillful.
Insidious.
Tenuous; rarefied; of low density or thin consistency.
Refined; exquisite.
To make like a devil; to invest with the character of a devil.
To annoy or bother.
To work as a ‘devil’; to work for a lawyer or writer without fee or recognition.
To prepare (food) with spices, making it spicy:
Possessed by the Devil
Grilled with a piquant sauce
To shorten (something) by, or as if by, cutting part of it off.
To shorten (a decimal number) by removing trailing (or leading) digits.
To replace a corner by a plane (or to make a similar change to a crystal).
Heavy denim pants or trousers, usually with bib and braces, worn especially as work clothing.
definitions.example: Helen donned a pair of faded dungarees and grabbed her knapsack before rushing off to school.

definitions.definition: A horse of a middle-weight classification, between draught horses and thoroughbreds.
Not violable; not to be infringed.
Not susceptible to violence, or of being profaned, corrupted, or dishonoured.
Incapable of being injured or invaded; indestructible.
A wash, an act of washing.
definitions.example: Swishy, swishy, swashy. Give your hands a washy.

definitions.definition: Watery; damp; soft.
Lacking substance or strength; weak; thin; dilute; feeble.
definitions.example: washy resolutions

definitions.definition: Not firm or hardy; liable to sweat profusely with labour.
definitions.example: a washy horse

definitions.definition: A blow that produces a muffled sound.
The sound of such a blow; a thud.
Used to replace the vulgar or blasphemous element in "what the hell" and similar phrases.
definitions.example: Where the thump have you been?!

definitions.definition: To hit (someone or something) as if to make a thump.
To cause to make a thumping sound.
definitions.example: The cat thumped its tail in irritation.

definitions.definition: To thud or pound.
To throb with a muffled rhythmic sound.
definitions.example: Dance music thumped from the nightclub entrance.

definitions.definition: A group of people who collectively perform research and develop reports and recommendations on topics relating to strategic planning or public policy, and which is usually funded by corporate, government, or special interests.
To perform research and develop recommendations as part of a think tank.
